docs.abstract: In a 5-to-4 ruling, the court reversed decisions finding that an array of voting districts had discriminated against minority voters, but it did rule that one was an impermissible racial gerrymander.
docs.snippet: In a 5-to-4 ruling, the court reversed decisions finding that an array of voting districts had discriminated against minority voters, but it did rule that one was an impermissible racial gerrymander.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Monday largely upheld an array of congressional and state legislative districts in Texas, reversing trial court rulings that said the districts violated the Constitution and the Voting Rights Act by discriminating against voters on the basis of race.

headline.main: Supreme Court Upholds Texas Voting Maps That Were Called Discriminatory
headline.print_headline: Texas Voting Map, Called Illegal, Is Upheld Because of an Error by a Lower Court

docs.abstract: The man, Naif Abdulaziz M. Alfallaj, was found after the authorities matched his fingerprints to those on an application to join Al Qaeda’s most notorious training camp.
docs.snippet: The man, Naif Abdulaziz M. Alfallaj, was found after the authorities matched his fingerprints to those on an application to join Al Qaeda’s most notorious training camp.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A Saudi immigrant who attended Al Qaeda’s most notorious training camp was arrested on a charge of lying to the F.B.I. and on two counts of visa fraud in Oklahoma, where he had been living for years with his family, federal law enforcement officials announced Tuesday.

headline.main: Saudi Who Attended Qaeda Camp Is Arrested in Oklahoma
headline.print_headline: U.S. Arrests Saudi Man With a Link To Al Qaeda

byline.original: By Adam Goldman and Matt Apuzzo

docs.abstract: Mr. Tillerson’s dismissal pulls the White House even further out of the economic and foreign policy mainstream and closer to the nationalist ideas that animated Mr. Trump’s presidential campaign.
docs.snippet: Mr. Tillerson’s dismissal pulls the White House even further out of the economic and foreign policy mainstream and closer to the nationalist ideas that animated Mr. Trump’s presidential campaign.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump ousted on Tuesday his secretary of state, Rex W. Tillerson, the most dramatic in a cascade of personnel moves that suggest Mr. Trump is determined to surround himself with loyalists more willing to reflect his “America First” views.

headline.main: In Replacing Tillerson With Pompeo, Trump Turns to Loyalists Who Reflect ‘America First’ Views
headline.print_headline: Tillerson Ousted as Trump Silences Dissent in Cabinet

byline.original: By Mark Landler, Maggie Haberman and Gardiner Harris

docs.abstract: Among the newly accepted cases is an appeal from a death row inmate with a rare medical condition he says will cause excruciating pain if he is given a lethal injection.
docs.snippet: Among the newly accepted cases is an appeal from a death row inmate with a rare medical condition he says will cause excruciating pain if he is given a lethal injection.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court added three cases to its docket on Monday, agreeing to hear disputes about lethal injections, class-action settlements and arbitration.

headline.main: Supreme Court to Hear Cases on Death Penalty and Class Actions
headline.print_headline: Justices to Hear Death Row Case and 2 Others

docs.abstract: A by-the-book dismissal for cause, or part of a White House smear campaign? We sort out the facts.
docs.snippet: A by-the-book dismissal for cause, or part of a White House smear campaign? We sort out the facts.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Andrew G. McCabe, the former F.B.I. deputy director, was fired late Friday night — on the eve of his retirement. Here’s what we know.

headline.main: Andrew McCabe’s Firing: Here’s What We Know
headline.print_headline: Sorting Out the Facts of McCabe’s Firing Amid a War of Words

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: A computer failure crippled a crucial part of the agency’s website that allows taxpayers to make their payments directly from their bank accounts on the day taxes were due.
docs.snippet: A computer failure crippled a crucial part of the agency’s website that allows taxpayers to make their payments directly from their bank accounts on the day taxes were due.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Millions of taxpayers who waited until Tuesday to file their 2017 tax returns and make payments through the Internal Revenue Service’s website were thwarted by a systemwide computer failure that advised last-minute filers to “come back on Dec. 31, 9999.”

headline.main: I.R.S. Website Crashes on Tax Day as Millions Tried to File Returns
headline.print_headline: Dawdling Filers Turn Disgruntled as I.R.S. Website Crashes on the Final Day

docs.abstract: Jennifer Lawrence, her director and a C.I.A. master of disguise discuss Russia, spy craft and their new film “Red Sparrow” with The New York Times.
docs.snippet: Jennifer Lawrence, her director and a C.I.A. master of disguise discuss Russia, spy craft and their new film “Red Sparrow” with The New York Times.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A former C.I.A. officer, actress Jennifer Lawrence, her director and a veteran New York Times reporter who covered the fall of the Soviet Union discussed spy craft, Russia’s meddling in the 2016 election and the difficulties of developing a Russian accent.

headline.main: Jennifer Lawrence as a Russian ‘Sparrow’: Four Takeaways

keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: At a secure facility outside Washington, the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives is examining evidence from the deadly Austin bombings.
docs.snippet: At a secure facility outside Washington, the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives is examining evidence from the deadly Austin bombings.
docs.lead_paragraph: BELTSVILLE, Md. — About an hour outside Washington, tucked in a cinder-block building run by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives, orderly piles of charred and twisted matter are spread across a secure laboratory.

headline.main: Anatomy of a Bomb Investigation: Inside an A.T.F. Lab
headline.print_headline: Anatomy of a Bomb Investigation: Dissecting Devices in an A.T.F. Lab

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms

docs.abstract: The A.T.F.’s weakened political position is partly because the N.R.A. has long used its sway to hobble the agency as well as because of a dearth of leadership and resources.
docs.snippet: The A.T.F.’s weakened political position is partly because the N.R.A. has long used its sway to hobble the agency as well as because of a dearth of leadership and resources.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For years, the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives has been overlooked in Washington. Overshadowed by more politically powerful law enforcement agencies like the F.B.I., the A.T.F. garnered headlines mostly for notorious episodes, including the deadly 1993 siege in Waco, Tex., and the “Fast and Furious” gunwalking scandal more than a decade later.

headline.main: How the N.R.A. Keeps Federal Gun Regulators in Check
headline.print_headline: How the N.R.A. Uses Its Influence to Hobble Federal Gun Regulators

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms

docs.abstract: The AR-15 cemented its place in American culture after the assault weapons ban ended, at a time of heightened interest in the military, and as shooting was popularized in video game culture.
docs.snippet: The AR-15 cemented its place in American culture after the assault weapons ban ended, at a time of heightened interest in the military, and as shooting was popularized in video game culture.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jeff Swarey bought his AR-15 rifle five years ago after shooting guns in video games. Jessie K. Fletcher, a former Marine sniper, was given one by his platoon after he stepped on a bomb in Afghanistan that blew off his legs. Jessica Dorantes, a Texas police officer, will not go on patrol without hers.

headline.main: Once Banned, Now Loved and Loathed: How the AR-15 Became ‘America’s Rifle’
headline.print_headline: Once Banned, ‘America’s Rifle’ Is Fiercely Loved and Loathed

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms

byline.original: By Ali Watkins, John Ismay and Thomas Gibbons-Neff
